results.byline: By Norimitsu Onishi and Nasuna Stuart-Ulin
results.title: How a Town Famous for Xenophobia Fell in Love With Immigrants
results.abstract: “We now want as many immigrants as possible,” said Bernard Thompson, the mayor of Hérouxville, Quebec, a onetime supporter of the town’s anti-immigrant code.

media.caption: The city center of Hérouxville is quiet and mostly residential, with few vacant properties. Affordable housing is a primary concern for regional officials hoping to stimulate immigration to the area.
media.copyright: Nasuna Stuart-Ulin for The New York Times
